comment: Relate a limit of a real-valued sequence at infinity to the continuity of the corresponding extended real function at ` +oo ` . Since any ` ~~>r ` limit can be written in the form on the left side of the implication, this shows that real limits are a special case of topological continuity at a point. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)
